oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE AXIALLY SYMMETRICAL PROBLEM OF A PENNY-SHAPED CRACK UNDER GENERAL SURFACE LOADINGS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PARIHAR, KS
RAO, JVSK
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The axially symmetric stress distribution in the neighbourhood of a penny-shaped crack is considered. The penny-shaped crack is subjected to surface tractions which are symmetrical about the centre of the crack but not necessarily self-equilibrating. The problem was tackled previously in the literature with the use of the Abel transform of the first kind. In the present paper, the Abel transform of the second kind is employed to deal with the problem. It is observed that the latter transform makes the solution mathematically simpler.
